sen.j: 翌585年（同14年）3月、物部守屋による廃仏運動により法衣を剥ぎ取られて全裸にされ、海石榴市（つばいち、奈良県桜井市）の駅舎で鞭打ちの刑に処された。
sen.e: On the next March 585, Zenshin-ni was taken off all her clerical garments, being stripped naked, and punished by whipping at the Station of Tsubaichi market place (present-day Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture) due to an anti-Buddhist movement by MONONOBE no Moriya.

sen.e: After her return, she dwelled at Sakurai-ji Temple in Yamato Province (present-day presumably to be Toyura, Asuka village), and contributed the thriving of Buddhism by putting 11 nuns out into the world including ZENTOKU.
